newsitem.title: USA: Motorola to expand Land Mobile products plant.
newsitem.headline: Motorola to expand Land Mobile products plant.

text.p: Motorola Inc said Friday its Land Mobile Products Sector will build a 250,000-square-foot expansion to its existing 615,000-square-foot facility here.

Motorola, based in Schaumburg, Ill., said the expansion will allow it to consolidate a number of off-site Land Mobile operations in the area. It also will provide additional manufacturing and administrative space to meet growing worldwide demand for Motorola two-way radio products.
As a part of the expansion, Motorola plans to add more than 250 jobs by the end of 1998.

Motorola said construction is scheduled to begin in June and conclude in the third quarter of 1998. A child care and learning center and a wellness center for Motorola employees will be built on the campus.

"This expansion highlights the growing importance of the Plantation facility in serving our two-way radio customers around the world," Leif Soderberg, corporate vice president and general manager of Motorola's Radio Products Americas Group, said in a statement.
A variety of digital and analog two-way radios, including iDEN phones, MTS 200O portables, HT1OOO portables, MT1000/MT 200O portables, and ASTRO radios, are manufactured at the Plantation facility.

Proximity to customers also was a very important factor in the decisoin to expand at Plantation. Motorola said the facility is headquarters to the sector's Radio Products Americas Group, which provides two-way radio products to users in the growing market of Latin America as well as the United States and Canada.
